Posts.Content: Hi It seems those in the know are recommending cialis 5mg daily to start if your neural tissue is only lightly 'stunned' from the op then you should be a responder to meds and its worthwhile continuing with them If you don't notice any changes maybe discuss using a booster dose of cialis with your GP (make sure you take them on an empty stomach though) If still a non responder there is some merit (certainly financially!) in ceasing the drugs and trying another approach for a while then retrying the drugs in a couple of months Maybe injection therapy would work well in this case of non drug responsiveness Penile rehab needs blood flow and I know over here in Australia we try to encourage 2-3 erections per week (either voluntary or induced) to maintain health penile blood flow Hope this helps with your decision making Stuart
Posts.Signature: Stuart Baptist | Director | Senior Physiotherapist | BSc (Hons) Physio | RPT | MAPA | CFA __________________________________________________ ____________________________
Posts.Title: 3 Weeks post-op + path report

Posts.Content: great work...good outcome....doesn't get any better! it is amazing how well our body can 'cheat!' though isn't it the ultrasound is a great tool for visualising the muscles in action
Posts.Signature: Stuart Baptist | Director | Senior Physiotherapist | BSc (Hons) Physio | RPT | MAPA | CFA __________________________________________________ ____________________________
Posts.Title: Continence Training

Posts.Content: Not here for business, Just here to help if I can Happy to remove the signature if you are concerned Stu
Posts.Title: Continence Training

Posts.Content: Hi Bob You make some interesting points. Ornish et al 2013 just released a poignant paper on lifestyle modifications for men on AS which despite its small size merits consideration. My take on things is based on the fact that historically we know incontinence in women is helped by pelvic floor training but unfortunately we have just assumed that strength training is therefore going to benefit men following prostate surgery. With the damage done during childbirth to the female pelvic floor (stretch/tear) it makes sense to recover with a strength program, but the surgical trauma during prostatectomy is quite different. I don't have the answers (yet!) but I'm looking. I personally think that we may need a period of time (about 3 weeks) post op where we just plain rest and take it easy. Allow mother nature to recover naturally and listen to our bodies. I tell most of my guys to undertake predominately dry activities only (even if this means to rest up, sit down and avoid all activities that cause the recovering sphincter muscles to fail - i.e. leak) I also think that it is beneficial to undertake a period of preoperative motor training (skill acquisition) whereby we use the ultrasound machine transperineally to teach guys how to bias more contractile effort AWAY from the anal sphincter (levator ani) and more towards the puboperineals/external urinary sphincter (penile bias) My first study (currently awaiting review for publication) showed that you can teach the skill of motor acquisition within a clinically reasonable period form most guys (1.5 physio sessions average) but the most success in skill acquisition occurred in the group we saw pre operatively. Maybe we don't need strength Maybe we just need to restimulate the motor memory through more selective biassing of our kegel exercises ( a bit like golf....dont just focus on hitting the ball hard....maybe improve your swing first!!) I'm finding the research bit tough as I'ma through and through clinician but I feel we need to focus on research rather than just churn out the 'womens health' solution to a mens health problem Stuart
Posts.Signature: Stuart Baptist | Director | Senior Physiotherapist | BSc (Hons) Physio | RPT | MAPA | CFA __________________________________________________ ____________________________

Posts.Title: Continence Training

Posts.Content: Hi There I thought I'd introduce myself I'm a physio in sydney who is specialising in mens health I'm moving towards a PhD researching the use of transabdominal and transperineal real time ultrasound in teaching men how to recruit their pelvic floor muscles more accurately. Happy to go into more detail if people want to hear some of the research were doing down under!!(sorry about the pun!) Stuart
Posts.Signature: Stuart Baptist | Director | Senior Physiotherapist | BSc (Hons) Physio | RPT | MAPA | CFA __________________________________________________ ____________________________
Posts.Title: Continence Training

Posts.Content: hey bob i think the reasons may in fact be quite multifactoria the op itself is a hugely complex one. for some the dissection is easy (quick return to continence) and for others the op is more complex (hence slower recovery time) Prostatic Urethral length has been shown to predict continence outcomes I think that the more your brain can identify the anterior components of the continence mechanism that this can only help Like i say..more research is definitely needed Stuart
Posts.Signature: Stuart Baptist | Director | Senior Physiotherapist | BSc (Hons) Physio | RPT | MAPA | CFA __________________________________________________ ____________________________
